intro: Aechmea bicolor, commonly known as the pink bromeliad, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup to collect water. The plant produces striking pink or red flowers that bloom from the center of the rosette. Its foliage is often variegated with white and green stripes, adding visual interest. Aechmea bicolor is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements.
